suppress.notes: Applies to jruby versions less than v1.4.1, as of this writing, we are at v9
Applies to jruby versions less than v1.6.5.1, as of this writing, we are at v9
JRuby's Java re-implementation of OpenSSL is falsely detected as the C implmentation of OpenSSL
file name: jsch.agentproxy.usocket-nc-0.0.9.jar I don't know why this was being associated with netcat cpe, but I see no evidence on the web of this lib itself having security issues.
file name: core.async-1.5.648.jar False match with https://github.com/caolan/async
file name: snappy-0.4.jar How a vulnerability in the Python Electrum project matched snappy, I dunno! False positive.

Google has marked the risky Guava function as deprecated and, at the time of this writing, will do no more. https://github.com/google/guava/issues/4011 Guava is brought in by by owasp-java-html-sanitizer.
CVE-2023-4759 was addressed in jgit 6.7.0 and should not be triggered (but still is)

Description: In Clojure before 1.9.0, classes can be used to construct a serialized object that executes arbitrary code upon deserialization. This is relevant if a server deserializes untrusted objects. Is falsely matching on various clojure libs, not clojure itself. We are using current vesion of clojure. So suppress.

We are on Jetty 11.0.20...not sure why these are matching probably because there is an assumption we are on websocket api is version differently, at the time of this writing it is at 2.0.0.
